snippet: The deaths occurred after officers demanded the removal of blockades from roads leading to the headquarters of the preacher, Muhammad Tahir-ul-Qadri.
abstract: Violent clashes in Lahore, Pakistan, between police and followers of Muhammad Tahir-ul-Qadri, fiery preacher turned political activist, result in at least seven people killed and about 100 wounded.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The deaths occurred after officers demanded the removal of blockades from roads leading to the headquarters of the preacher, Muhammad Tahir-ul-Qadri.

headline.main: 7 Killed as Pakistan Police Clash With Preacher’s Followers
headline.print_headline: 7 Killed as Pakistan Police Clash With Preacher’s Followers
